intro: Descurainia leptoclada, commonly known as slender bladderpod, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, alternate leaves, and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It produces distinctive pods that contain several seeds, typical of the mustard family. Descurainia leptoclada is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
